definition: to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

sentences.english: The driver turns off the engine and exits the car to retrieve my suitcase from the trunk.
sentences.chinese: 於是，司機停下車，幫我把行囊從後備箱裏卸了下來。

sentences.english: It's in my suitcase. In the trunk.
sentences.chinese: 放在我汽車後備箱的行李裏。

sentences.english: I would just pile it all in the car and that would be enough.
sentences.chinese: 我常會把雜貨堆在後備箱，那樣就足夠了。

sentences.english: we just piled up all the groceries in the trunk of the car and drive home.
sentences.chinese: 我們會把雜貨堆放在車的後備箱裏，然後開車回家。

sentences.english: American reporter jumps down a car loathly, opened the mothball box of his car.
sentences.chinese: 美國記者不情願地跳下車來，打開了他轎車的後備箱。

sentences.english: I keep a first-aid kit in the trunk of my car.
sentences.chinese: 我總是在車子的後備箱裏準備一個急救箱。

sentences.english: Taxi-driver: Let me put them in the trunk.
sentences.chinese: 讓我把他們放在後備箱裏。

sentences.english: Put your dog and your spouse in the trunk of the car for an hour.
sentences.chinese: 把你的狗和你的配偶一起放在汽車的後備箱關一小時。

sentences.english: The rear opens like a hatchback for luggage.
sentences.chinese: 汽車的後備箱卻像兩廂車一樣是掀背式的。

sentences.english: It isl fit easily into the trunk of the cruiser.
sentences.chinese: 這幾袋行李很容易就塞進了放哨車的後備箱。

sentences.english: At the same time, rolling box placed in the car trunk, the can play the role of anti-theft.
sentences.chinese: 同時收卷箱放置在汽車後備箱內，能起到防盜的作用。
